explanation: Quietly and incrementally syncs user Documents to a remote SSH server on port 443 using rsync’s native compression and update logic to minimize repeated transfers, aligning with T1020 automated exfiltration.
rationale_steps: Throttle and compress transfer to reduce footprint.
Use rsync --update to avoid re-sending unchanged files.
Tunnel via SSH with non-interactive options to avoid prompts.
Quiet mode (-q) suppresses output to remain stealthy.
